intro: Faramea silvae, commonly known as the forest faramea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly in the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a glossy surface and dark green coloration. Faramea silvae is often found growing in shaded, humid environments within dense forest canopies.
